1.text: A Name to be chosen rather than much riches, and good grace rather than gold.

2.text: The rich and poor one met together: Jehovah made them all.

3.text: The crafty saw evil, and he will hide, and the simple passed on and were punished.

4.text: The end of humility the fear of Jehovah, riches and honor and life.

5.text: Thorns, snares, in the way of the perverse one: he watching his soul shall be far from them.

6.text: Straiten to a youth upon the mouth of his way, also when he shall grow old he will not depart from it.

7.text: The rich one will rule over the poor, and he borrowing, a servant to the man lending.

8.text: He sowing iniquity shall reap vanity, and the rod of his wrath shall be finished.

9.text: The good eye it shall be blessed, for he gave from his bread to the poor.

10.text: Cast out him mocking, and strife shall go out, and contention shall cease and dishonor.

11.text: He loving pureness of heart the grace of his lips, the king is his friend.

12.text: The eyes of Jehovah guarded knowledge, and he will overthrow the words of him transgressing.

13.text: The slothful one said, A lion without; I shall be slain in the midst of the broad places.

14.text: The mouth of the strange woman a deep pit: and he cursing Jehovah shall fall there.

15.text: Folly being bound in the heart of a youth; the rod of correction shall remove it far off from him.

16.text: He oppressing the poor one to increase for himself, he gave to the rich; also to want.

17.text: Incline thine ear and hear the words of the wise, and thou shalt set thy heart to my knowledge.

18.text: For pleasant things if thou shalt watch them in thy belly; they shall be prepared together for thy lips.

19.text: For thy trust to be in Jehovah, I caused thee to know today, thee also.

20.text: Did I not write to thee three days ago in counsels and knowledge?

21.text: To cause thee to know the truth of the words of truth; to turn back the words of truth to those sending thee?

22.text: Thou shalt not strip the poor because he is poor: and thou shalt not crush the humble in the gate.

23.text: For Jehovah will contend their contention, and rob the soul to those robbing them.

24.text: Thou shalt not be companion of the possessor of anger, and with the man of wrath thou shalt not go:

25.text: Lest thou shalt learn his ways and take a snare to thy soul.

26.text: Thou shalt not be with those striking the hand with those pledging for debts.

27.text: If not to thee to requite, why shall he take thy bed from under thee?

28.text: Thou shalt not remove the old bound which thy fathers made.

29.text: Sawest thou a man apt in his works? Before kings shall he stand; he shall not stand before the dark ones.
